data.text: @telos32 @kevin32thomas @WalesOnline I'm obviously missing something here, but how can something be indirect in a person's death? Are you saying someone who dies of terminal cancer or in a car crash but has tested positive within 28 days should be counted along with people who died ONLY of Covid?
@kevin32thomas @WalesOnline No it’s not. Stop being a Fanny. You didn’t explain anything lol

@DragonflyHypno @kevin32thomas @WalesOnline AIUI, these figures are where Covid is mentioned on the Death Certificate as a factor (direct or indirect) in a person’s death. If it was irrelevant to the death it wouldn’t be on the Death Certificate.

@kevin32thomas @telos32 @WalesOnline Don't know about you but I'm sick to death of trying to explain that dying 'with' Covid doesn't mean you die 'of' it. These statistics need to be clarified, because as you say they are incredibly misleading and are scaremongering.

@Tinfoildestroy @WalesOnline Yes reporting numbers of cases at this point is fear mongering.  I've al ready told you why reporting deaths with out cause of death is fear mongering.  Now move on because I won't explain again
@Tinfoildestroy @WalesOnline As a lot people are catching covid in hospital this a fear mongering not accurate reporting

@telos32 @WalesOnline Not going to disagree that is a possibility but it also possibility they died from something they would have died from with or with out covid . That's why these reports should be taken for what they are . A very inaccurate way of reporting.
@WalesOnline Key word being "with" and it can't possibly be covid because cold virus strains mutate too often. Just a cold and some evil scaremongering

@kevin32thomas @WalesOnline There will probably be people who have died from diabetes, high blood pressure, asthma etc., conditions that are not normally life threatening with the correct medication. However, Covid makes them so. So they may have died from diabetes but Covid was the cause of death.
